channel.title: Logging In [PI]
channel.description:
Hey, So I recently added the new login box as the one I had was very ugly. Anyways the problem is when you log into an account and say they go afk and log out and come back and log in the client freezes this is the same even when they log into another account, the error that I get in the CMD of client is:
[code=text] Error: T2 - 126,126,126 - 6,3032,3440 - 49,47,49,10,87,101, Exception in thread "Thread-3" java.lang.NullPointerException at client.drawGameScreen(client.java:8995) at client.processDrawing(client.java:9762) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:138) at client.run(client.java:5003) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)[/code]
Help please someone?
Thanks, RS PS

item.title: Logging In [PI]
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Just noticed this is in the wrong section, I’m not too good client sided, post in client help and have a better chance at getting a response.

Read full topic

item.title: Logging In [PI]
item.dc:creator: @RS_PS RS PS
item.description:
@RS_PS wrote:

When I log out the login box shows :s

It’s when I login to the server it freezes

I still have the old client and it has no problems but the login box looks very ugly so I want to change it.

Read full topic

item.title: Logging In [PI]
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I have a feeling that it can’t find the images for the login box, thats why it can’t draw them.

Read full topic

item.title: Logging In [PI]
item.dc:creator: @RS_PS RS PS
item.description:
@RS_PS wrote:

tyb97:

Does the initDrawingArea method exist in the RSImageProducer class?

Yes buddy,

public void initDrawingArea() { DrawingArea.initDrawingArea(anInt317, anInt316, anIntArray315); }

Read full topic
